CatDescriptText: Mr. Jessie Belton, railroad worker, Miller Street, McDonald, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "I think that they should be able to spend the money as they like it and not have to report it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jessie Belton wearing light colored cross hatch patterned zippered jacket, standing on Fifth Avenue, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
